title: Broadcom cuts Qualcomm offer to $117 billion after new NXP deal
blurb: Microchip maker Broadcom Ltd <AVGO.O> cut its bid for Qualcomm Inc <QCOM.O> on Wednesday by 4 percent to $117 billion as it objected to Qualcomm’s decision to raise its own bid for NXP Semiconductors NV <NXPI.O> to $44 billion.

title: Americans prefer bank branches over mobile apps for opening new accounts
blurb: Mobile banking apps keep getting better, but 60 percent of Americans would still rather open a new checking account in person at a bank branch than on a phone, tablet or desktop computer, according to a new survey.

title: Snapchat promises update after users balk at redesign
blurb: Snap Inc's <SNAP.N> Snapchat on Tuesday responded to a Change.org petition that sought a reversal of the messaging app's latest redesign.

title: U.S. SEC updates guidance on cyber attack disclosure for companies
blurb: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday updated guidance to public companies on how and when they should disclose cyber security risks and breaches, including disclosing potential weaknesses that have not yet been targeted by hackers.

title: Daimler to start serial production of eActros truck in 2021
blurb: Daimler <DAIGn.DE> said on Wednesday it aims to start serial production of an electric heavy truck with a range of 200 km (124 miles) in 2021, Daimler Trucks chief Martin Daum said.

title: Nokia sees no path for 'struggling' digital health business: memo
blurb: Nokia does not see meaningful potential for its "struggling" digital health business which includes activity trackers and smartwatches, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

title: British bank RBS hires 'digital human' Cora on probation
blurb: A life-like avatar called Cora is being put through her paces by Royal Bank of Scotland <RBS.L>, helping customers with basic queries and giving its digital banking drive a more human face.

title: Apple in talks with miners to secure cobalt supplies: sources
blurb: Apple Inc is talking to major cobalt producers to secure supplies of the material vital for the lithium-ion rechargeable batteries that power its mobile phones, three cobalt industry sources said.

title: U.S. Intel plans $5 billion investment in Israeli plant: minister
blurb: Intel Corp plans to invest $5 billion to expand production at its Kiryat Gat plant in southern Israel, Israeli Economy Minister Eli Cohen said on Wednesday after talks with the U.S. chipmaker.

title: Bitcoins for free? Japanese cryptocurrency exchange lands in hot water again
blurb: A blunder at a Japanese cryptocurrency exchange let investors briefly buy bitcoins for free - though none were able to profit from the mistake.

title: Human rights groups say Mexico not investigating spyware claims
blurb: A group of human and digital rights activists said on Tuesday that the Mexican government had failed to properly investigate allegations their smartphones were infected with spying software. They have asked for an independent investigation.

title: Venezuela says launch of 'petro' cryptocurrency raised $735 million
blurb: President Nicolas Maduro said Tuesday that Venezuela had received $735 million in the first day of a pre-sale of the country's “petro” cryptocurrency, aimed at pulling the country out of an economic tailspin.

title: Avis steers into crowded field for managing ride services fleets
blurb: When Avis Budget Group Inc <CAR.O> reports its results on Wednesday, executives under pressure from restive shareholders will likely point to the potential for profits from managing fleets of vehicles for ride services and robo-taxi companies.

title: Public transit app Moovit raises $50 million in round led by Intel
blurb: Public transit app Moovit said on Wednesday it raised $50 million in an investment round led by Intel Capital, bringing its total raised to date to $133 million.

title: Temenos agrees 1.4 billion pounds deal for Fidessa, activist Elliott enters
blurb: Temenos agreed a 1.4 billion pound ($1.96 billion) takeover of British software peer Fidessa Group on Wednesday, whose shares traded above the offer price after activist investor Elliott Capital Advisors disclosed a stake.

title: Artificial intelligence poses risks of misuse by hackers, researchers say
blurb: Rapid advances in artificial intelligence are raising risks that malicious users will soon exploit the technology to mount automated hacking attacks, cause driverless car crashes or turn commercial drones into targeted weapons, a new report warns.

title: Bahrain's sovereign fund in talks to invest in SoftBank's Vision Fund: CEO
blurb: Bahrain's sovereign wealth fund Mumtalakat is in early talks to invest in Softbank Group's private equity fund that aims to target the technology sector, its chief executive said.

title: South Korea regulator flags better deal for cryptocurrency industry
blurb: A better deal for South Korea's cryptocurrency industry might be in the offing as the market regulator changes tack from its tough stance on the virtual coin trade, promising instead to help promote blockchain technology.

title: Computer shops embrace lucrative business: outfitting cryptocurrency miners
blurb: Some of the biggest electronics bazaars in Asia are being flooded with customers looking for the latest piece of technology: cryptocurrency mining rigs.

title: FCC reversal of net neutrality rules expected to be published Thursday: sources
blurb: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is expected to publish on Thursday its December order overturning the landmark Obama-era net neutrality rules, two sources briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

title: Sessions forms U.S. cyber task force after election warnings
blurb: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions on Tuesday announced he would create a task force to examine how his Justice Department can better combat global cyber threats, including efforts to interfere with elections or damage critical infrastructure.

title: Qualcomm deals blow to Broadcom's bid with sweetened NXP deal
blurb: U.S. semiconductor company Qualcomm Inc <QCOM.O> on Tuesday unveiled a sweetened $44 billion agreement to acquire NXP Semiconductors NV <NXPI.O>, its most defiant move in its defense against a hostile $121 billion bid from Broadcom Ltd <AVGO.O>.

title: Bitcoin nearly doubles in value from year's low hit in early February
blurb: Bitcoin hit a three-week high on Tuesday and has surged nearly 100 percent from its lowest level this year, as its recovery continued after South Korea's financial regulator eased its stance on cryptocurrencies, weeks after it considered shutting down digital currency exchanges.

title: ING says cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex has an account with it
blurb: Dutch financial services company ING <INGA.AS> on Tuesday confirmed that Bitfinex, one of the largest exchanges for trading in cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, has a bank account with it in the Netherlands.

title: Amazon credit card adds Whole Foods to 5 percent cash back offer
blurb: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday extended its 5 percent cash back benefit for Prime service subscribers to shoppers at its newly acquired Whole Foods Market grocery chain.

title: Xerox shareholders Icahn, Deason urge company to sell itself to rivals
blurb: Xerox Corp shareholders Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason said on Tuesday the U.S. company should seek to sell itself to one of its rivals or a private equity firm.

title: Lesser-known North Korea cyber-spy group goes international: report
blurb: A North Korean cyber espionage group previously known only for targeting South Korea's government and private sector deepened its sophistication and hit further afield including in Japan and the Middle East in 2017, security researchers said on Tuesday.

title: Medtronic quarterly revenue beats, margins disappoint
blurb: Medical device maker Medtronic Plc's quarterly revenue beat analysts' expectations as new product launches drove sales across its business units, but weaker-than-expected margins clouded the earnings report.

title: Indian software services sector to grow 7-9 percent in FY19 - lobby group
blurb: India's software services exports will see revenue growth of 7-9 percent in constant currency terms in the fiscal year to March 2019, a leading lobby group forecast on Tuesday, as the industry continues to recover from what has been a tough year.

title: Spain's Balearic Islands to fine Airbnb 300,000 euros for illegal rentals
blurb: Spain's Balearic Islands is fining flat-sharing and rental service Airbnb 300,000 euros ($370,140) for advertising unregistered homes in Mallorca on its web site, the regional government said on Tuesday.

title: Brazilian rule changes may allow telecoms firms to unload assets
blurb: Brazil's major telecoms operators stand to free up hundreds of millions of dollars to invest in technologies like 4G and broadband by unloading unwanted assets, as a push by the sector to overhaul decades-old rules shows signs of paying off.

title: Japan's cryptocurrency exchanges to form new self-regulating body: sources
blurb: Sixteen Japanese cryptocurrency exchanges will fix plans as early as next week to create a self-regulating body in a bid to better safeguard investors after a $530 million digital money heist last month, two source familiar with the plan said.

title: Language app Babbel translates European success to U.S. market
blurb: It might seem a tall order to persuade people to spend as much to learn a language on their smartphone as it costs to subscribe to a music streaming or video-on-demand service.

title: Japan's Sony to form alliance to build taxi-hailing system
blurb: Sony Corp <6758.T> said on Tuesday it would become the latest blue-chip firm to jockey for position in Japan's taxi and ride-hailing market, with plans for a joint venture to develop an artificial intelligence-based hailing system.

title: SimCorp shares surge after strong fourth quarter, higher dividend payout
blurb: Shares in Danish software developer SimCorp hit their highest level in six months on Tuesday after the company reported strong growth in the fourth quarter and said it would increase its dividend payout for 2017.

title: Uber CEO sees commercialization of flying taxis in 5-10 years
blurb: Uber Technologies Inc Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said on Tuesday he can see commercialization of the Uber Air flying taxi service happening within five to 10 years.

title: Malaysian firm adds Islamic certification to cryptocurrency
blurb: Malaysia-based firm HelloGold has received a sharia-compliant certification for its gold-backed cryptocurrency and plans to launch its online gold platform in Thailand later this year, the company said.

title: Adecco buys digital recruitment firm Vettery, price not disclosed
blurb: Staffing company Adecco <ADEN.S> said on Tuesday it bought U.S.-based online recruitment platform Vettery for an undisclosed sum to increase its footprint in the digital permanent recruitment market.

title: Samsung Electronics to slash OLED panel production as iPhone X demand disappoints: Nikkei
blurb: Samsung Electronics Co <005930.KS> will slash output of its organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels in response to its customer Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> decision to cut production of iPhone X amid weak demand, the Nikkei reported on Tuesday.

title: BoE's Carney says Bitcoin has 'pretty much failed' as currency
blurb: Bitcoin <BTC=BTSP> has failed as a currency measured by standard benchmarks, and is neither a store of value nor a useful way to buy things, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Monday.

title: Russia looms large as U.S. election officials prep for 2018
blurb: Ten months before the United States votes in its first major election since the 2016 presidential contest, U.S. state election officials huddled in Washington this weekend to swap strategies on dealing with an uninvited guest: Russia.

title: Israeli visual aid company OrCam valued at $1 billion
blurb: Israel's OrCam, which has developed a visual aid for the blind, has completed a funding round that values the company at $1 billion, putting it on track for a planned initial public offering (IPO), its chief executive said on Tuesday.

title: Uber drops opposition to London language test
blurb: Taxi app Uber [UBER.UL] is dropping a legal appeal against the introduction of more stringent English language tests for drivers in London after the city's transport regulator said it would water down its stringent proposals.

title: U.N. chief urges global rules for cyber warfare
blurb: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres called on Monday for global rules to minimize the impact of electronic warfare on civilians as massive cyber attacks look likely to become the first salvoes in future wars.

title: Congress sets sights on federal cryptocurrency rules
blurb: Jolted by the global investment craze over bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, U.S. lawmakers are moving to consider new rules that could impose stricter federal oversight on the emerging asset class, several top lawmakers told Reuters.

title: India bank hack 'similar' to $81 million Bangladesh central bank heist
blurb: Hackers who tried to steal nearly $2 million from India's City Union Bank this month used tactics similar to those employed in the unsolved cyber heist of $81 million from Bangladesh's central bank in 2016, City's CEO said on Monday.

title: Singapore competition agency to look closer at Uber tie-up with ComfortDelGro
blurb: Singapore's competition commission said on Monday it plans to do further in-depth assessment of the tie-up between the city-state's top taxi operator, ComfortDelGro, and Uber [UBER.UL], after an initial review.

title: Alibaba, Tencent rally troops amid $10 billion retail battle
blurb: China's tech giants Alibaba Group Holding Ltd <BABA.N> and Tencent Holdings Ltd <0700.HK>, worth a combined $1 trillion, are on a retail investment binge, forcing merchants to choose sides amid a battle for shoppers' digital wallets.

title: India's Reliance, global tech firms to invest $9.3 billion in industrial area
blurb: India's Reliance Industries Ltd and global technology companies will invest 600 billion rupees ($9.34 billion) over 10 years to set up an integrated industrial area in the western state of Maharashtra, the company's chairman Mukesh Ambani said.

title: Software may have helped Daimler pass U.S. emissions tests: report
blurb: U.S. investigators probing Mercedes maker Daimler <DAIGn.DE> have found that its cars were equipped with software which may have help them to pass diesel emissions tests, a German newspaper reported on Sunday, citing confidential documents.

title: India's City Union Bank CEO says suffered cyber hack via SWIFT system
blurb: India's City Union Bank <CTBK.NS> said on Sunday that "cyber criminals" had hacked its systems and transferred nearly $2 million through three unauthorized remittances to lenders overseas via the SWIFT financial platform.

title: Careem acquires Middle East online restaurant listing platform, to trial food delivery
blurb: Careem, a Middle East competitor to Uber Technologies [UBER.UL], said on Sunday it had acquired RoundMenu and would start trialing food delivery services through the restaurant listing and reservation online platform this month.

title: Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers
blurb: Facebook Inc will start using postcards sent by U.S. mail later this year to verify the identities and location of people who want to purchase U.S. election-related advertising on its site, a senior company executive said on Saturday.

title: Proxy advisory firm ISS says Qualcomm should negotiate sale to Broadcom
blurb: U.S. semiconductor company Qualcomm Inc should try to negotiate a sale to Broadcom Ltd following the latter's sweetened $121 billion offer, proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services Inc (ISS) said.

title: Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling
blurb: The Russian influence operation designed to tamper with the 2016 U.S. presidential election used a combination of old-school espionage tactics and 21st-century technologies that will not be easy to stop, even now that the methods have been exposed, experts said.

title: Venezuela cryptocurrency to draw investment from Turkey, Qatar-official
blurb: Venezuela's new "petro" cryptocurrency will attract investments from Turkey, Qatar, the United States and Europe, the country's cryptocurrency regulator said on Friday.

title: Uber plans to sell Southeast Asia business to Grab: CNBC
blurb: Uber Technologies [UBER.UL] is preparing to sell its Southeast Asia ride-hailing business to Singapore-based Grab in return for a substantial stake in the company, CNBC reported, citing two sources familiar with the matter.

title: Facebook loses Belgian privacy case, faces fine of up to $125 million
blurb: A Belgian court threatened Facebook <FB.O> on Friday with a fine of up to 100 million euros ($125 million) if it continued to break privacy laws by tracking people on third-party websites.

title: Malicious cyber activity cost U.S. up to $109 billion in 2016: White House report
blurb: Malicious cyber activity cost the U.S. economy between $57 billion and $109 billion in 2016, the White House Council of Economic Advisers estimated in a report on Friday.

title: Takata has resolved most objections to its U.S. bankruptcy: lawyer
blurb: A lawyer for Takata Corp's U.S. business, bankrupted by a recall of faulty air bags, indicated on Friday that the company is on the verge of receiving court approval for its reorganization and $1.6 billion sale of its non-air bag businesses.

title: Swiss watchdog to treat some cryptocurrency offerings as securities
blurb: Many digital currency issues, known as initial coin offerings (ICOs), will be treated as securities under regulatory guidelines published on Friday by Switzerland, which has become a global leader in the hot fundraising method.

title: Intel hit with 32 lawsuits over security flaws
blurb: Intel Corp said on Friday shareholders and customers had filed 32 class action lawsuits against the company in connection with recently-disclosed security flaws in its microchips.

title: Hyperinflation meets tech: Cash-scarce Venezuela sees boom in payment apps
blurb: Widerven Villegas and his brother wash some 30 cars a day at a parking lot in Caracas. Despite charging less than 50 cents, nobody pays them in cash.

title: WhatsApp to go ahead with 'full feature' money transfer service in India
blurb: WhatsApp will launch a "full feature" inter-bank money transfer service in India, its biggest market, after a test involving a million users, National Payments Corp of India said.

title: Hackers stole $6 million from Russian bank via SWIFT system: central bank
blurb: Unknown hackers stole 339.5 million roubles ($6 million) from a Russian bank last year in an attack using the SWIFT international payments messaging system, the Russian central bank said on Friday.

title: Exclusive: Walmart in talks to buy more than 40 percent of India's Flipkart - sources
blurb: Walmart Inc <WMT.N> is in talks to buy a stake of more than 40 percent in Indian e-commerce firm Flipkart, a direct challenge to Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> in Asia's third-largest economy, two sources familiar with the matter said on Friday.

title: Uber introduces new safety features as it fights to retain London license
blurb: Taxi service Uber , battling to retain its license to operate in the British capital, said on Friday it would introduce new safety features, including 24-hour telephone support for riders and drivers.

title: White House blames Russia for 'reckless' NotPetya cyber attack
blurb: The White House on Thursday blamed Russia for the devastating 'NotPetya' cyber attack last year, joining the British government in condemning Moscow for unleashing a virus that crippled parts of Ukraine's infrastructure and damaged computers in countries across the globe.

title: Kremlin rejects U.S. accusation that Russia is behind cyber attack
blurb: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday he denies Russia was responsible for the 'NotPetya' cyber attack last year, after the White House on Thursday joined the British government in accusing Moscow of the attack.

title: E-commerce firm Mercado Libre to open distribution centers in Mexico
blurb: Mercado Libre, Latin America's home-grown e-commerce firm, said on Thursday that it would open two large distribution centers in Mexico as part of an effort to improve its logistics in the country.

title: China's ZTE says is trusted partner after U.S. concern
blurb: Chinese telecoms equipment group ZTE Corp hit back on Thursday against concerns from U.S. lawmakers that it is a vehicle for Chinese espionage, saying it was a trusted partner of its U.S. customers, state news agency Xinhua reported.

title: U.S. probe finds bitcoin mining operation interfered with broadband network
blurb: The Federal Communications Commission said on Thursday an investigation had found that a Brooklyn bitcoin mining operation interfered with T-Mobile US Inc's <TMUS.O> broadband network.

title: Amazon to pay $1.2 million in settlement over pesticide sales, U.S. says
blurb: Amazon.com Inc will pay a $1.2 million penalty to settle nearly 4,000 alleged violations of U.S. law in a move to prevent harmful exposure to pesticides through illegal sales, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency said on Thursday.

title: Number of crypto hedge funds surges amid bitcoin volatility
blurb: Hedge funds focused on trading cryptocurrencies have struggled to eke out returns this year amid a sharp sell-off in the highly volatile market, in spite of a flood of new funds setting up to deploy investor cash.

title: Apple says working to fix Telugu script bug causing device crash
blurb: Apple Inc said on Thursday a bug in some versions of its operating systems is causing its devices to crash when a single character in Telugu, an Indian language, is sent to the device or typed in text editor.

title: Bitcoin rises above $10,000, strategist sees new high by July
blurb: Bitcoin rose above $10,000 on Thursday for the first time in more than two weeks, as investors bought back the digital currency after having fallen 70 percent from its all-time peak hit in mid-December.

title: U.S. regulator warns of cryptocurrency 'pump-and-dump' schemes
blurb: The U.S. derivatives regulator warned investors on Thursday about cryptocurrency "pump-and-dump" scams that aim to rip off investors by inflating the price of volatile virtual tokens through spreading bogus information.

title: Thousands of FedEx customer records exposed by unsecured server
blurb: Global package delivery company FedEx Corp <FDX.N> said on Thursday it has secured some of the customer identification records that were visible earlier this month on an unsecured server, and so far has found no evidence that private data was "misappropriated."

title: BBVA-backed U.S. digital banking startup Azlo readies for launch
blurb: Azlo, a U.S. digital banking startup that is majority-owned by Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria S.A. <BBVA.MC>, will open for business this week, marking the latest effort by the Spanish lender to attract a new generation of digital-savvy customers.

title: VW looks at Apple for electric-car design guidance
blurb: Volkswagen <VOWG_p.DE> is looking at Apple <AAPL.O> products for guidance on how to style its new generation of electric cars, its top designer said, as the automaker aims to turn profits on battery-powered vehicles when they launch in 2020.

title: IBM lawsuit casts diversity in starkly competitive terms
blurb: International Business Machines Corp's <IBM.N> insistence in a new lawsuit that its efforts to recruit and maintain a diverse workforce are trade secrets bucks a trend towards transparency and highlights how companies can see the issue in competitive terms, business and legal experts said.

title: EU tells Facebook, Google and Twitter to do more for users
blurb: Europe's justice commissioner told Facebook <FB.O>, Twitter <TWTR.N> and Google <GOOGL.O> on Thursday to do more to bring their user terms in line with EU law, ramping up pressure on the tech giants after their efforts were deemed too little.

title: Google's app network quietly becomes huge growth engine
blurb: Google makes ads show up in more smartphone apps than any other technology company. That is the core of a resurgent business for parent Alphabet Inc.

title: Israeli startup CommonSense Robotics raises $20 million
blurb: Israel's CommonSense Robotics, whose technology enables retailers to offer quick and affordable grocery deliveries, said on Thursday it has raised $20 million in an early-stage investment round, bringing its total funding to $26 million.

title: Russia denies British allegations that Moscow was behind cyber-attack
blurb: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday Russia categorically denies allegations from a British official that Russia was responsible for the "NotPetya" cyber-attack last year.

title: Nokia starts review of digital health business, cuts jobs in Finland
blurb: Finnish network gear maker Nokia has started a strategic review of its digital health business and announced more than 400 job cuts in its home country.

title: Qualcomm meets Broadcom to discuss $121 billion acquisition offer
blurb: Qualcomm Inc said on Wednesday it met with Broadcom Ltd earlier in the day to discuss the latter's revised $121 billion bid, the first time the chipmakers have discussed what would be the technology sector's largest ever acquisition.

title: Esports get a cool reception at Winter Games
blurb: (This story corrects country Esports player represented in tournament in 12th paragraph in February 13 story.)

title: Coincheck hit by lawsuit as investors seek restart of cryptocurrency withdrawals
blurb: Cryptocurrency investors launched a lawsuit against Coincheck Inc on Thursday, seeking to force the Tokyo-based exchange to allow them to withdraw assets worth $183,000 frozen after last month's $530 million heist of digital money.

title: Amazon says to create 2,000 jobs in France in 2018
blurb: U.S. online retail giant Amazon said on Thursday it will create 2,000 permanent contract positions this year in France, its largest market in Europe after Britain and Germany.

title: French start-up Sigfox faces 5G juggernaut in Internet of Things
blurb: French start-up Sigfox, which builds networks to connect washing machines and other objects to the internet, says it is struggling to meet its growth targets due to high expectations for alternative, forthcoming 5G services.

title: Cisco tops estimates as turnaround takes center stage
blurb: Cisco Systems Inc reported its first rise in quarterly revenue in more than two years and forecast upbeat current-quarter profit, as the network gear maker's years-long efforts to transform into a software-focused company begins to pay off.

title: Applied Materials first-quarter results, current-quarter forecast beat on chip demand
blurb: Applied Materials Inc <AMAT.O> reported first-quarter profit and revenue above Wall Street estimates as the world's largest semiconductor equipment maker benefited from higher demand for flat panel displays and chips used in electronic items.

title: Walmart goes to the cloud to close gap with Amazon
blurb: One of Walmart Inc's best chances at taking on Amazon.com Inc in e-commerce lies with six giant server farms, each larger than ten football fields.

title: Mosaic network will reward researchers with its own cryptocurrency
blurb: A group of academics and technology experts will soon launch a blockchain-powered network that will reward quality research with its own cryptocurrency called Mosaic.

title: Israeli tech firm undercuts facial recognition to bolster privacy
blurb: Big brother is watching. But in the future he may no longer be so all-knowing.

title: SpaceX gets U.S. regulator to back satellite internet plan
blurb: Elon Musk's SpaceX, fresh off the successful launch this month of the world's most powerful rocket, won an endorsement on Wednesday from the top U.S. communications regulator to build a broadband network using satellites.

title: FTC nominees open to tech probes, concerned about high drug prices
blurb: The Federal Trade Commission should be open to investigating big tech firms like Google or Facebook if they use their power inappropriately and should create a drug pricing task force to identify unusual price increases, Joe Simons said at a hearing to consider his nomination to head the agency.

title: Google raises price of YouTube TV, adds sports, Turner
blurb: Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google is raising the price of its YouTube TV online service for new customers as it adds channels from Time Warner Inc's <TWX.N> Turner, National Basketball League and Major League Baseball, the company said Wednesday.

title: Rise of the data protection officer, the hottest tech ticket in town
blurb: They may not have the cachet of entrepreneurs, or geek chic of developers, but data protection officers are suddenly the hottest properties in technology.

title: CFTC Commissioner urges crypto companies to self-regulate
blurb: A top official for a U.S. financial regulator is urging players in the burgeoning cryptocurrency sector to boost their self-policing.

title: Apple in talks for first order from Chinese chipmaker: Nikkei
blurb: Apple Inc is in talks to buy storage chips from Yangtze Memory Technologies, a move that would mark the iPhone maker's first buy from a Chinese memory chipmaker, the Nikkei reported on Wednesday.

title: Baidu earnings beat forecasts, eyes U.S. listing for video unit iQiyi
blurb: Chinese internet search firm Baidu Inc posted a forecast-beating quarterly revenue increase and unveiled a U.S. listing plan for its Netflix-like video platform iQiyi as it looks to rev up new drivers for growth.

title: Toshiba names ex-banker as CEO, seen tackling opposition to chip unit sale
blurb: Toshiba Corp appointed a former banker experienced in dealing with distressed companies as CEO, and forecast its first annual profit in four years, helped by a buoyant chip business that it has agreed to sell.

title: Uber's fourth-quarter loss narrows to $1.1 billion: source
blurb: Uber Technologies Inc narrowed its fourth-quarter loss to $1.1 billion from a loss of $1.46 billion in the previous quarter, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.

title: Mi mi mi: super fans of China's Xiaomi stoke IPO ambitions
blurb: Wang Bin, 29, is a serious "mi fan", one of the ardent followers of Xiaomi Technology Co Ltd, the maker of smartphones and other electronic products that looks headed for a big initial public offering, perhaps as early as this year.

title: Japan Display books fourth straight quarterly loss, no partner yet
blurb: Japan Display Inc reported a fourth straight quarter of loss and said its search for a global partnership was taking more time than expected, showing its growing struggles as customers shift to a newer display technology.

title: U.S. senators concerned about Chinese access to intellectual property
blurb: China is trying to gain access to sensitive U.S. technologies and intellectual properties through telecommunications companies, academia and joint business ventures, U.S. senators and spy chiefs warned on Tuesday at a Senate hearing.

title: Chinese online retailer JD.com raises $2.5 billion for logistics arm
blurb: JD.com Inc said on Wednesday it had raised $2.5 billion for its logistics arm, as the second-largest Chinese e-commerce firm seeks to further bolster its position in online retail in its home country and beyond.

title: Sam's Club consolidates membership structure, offers free shipping
blurb: Warehouse chain Sam's Club, a unit of Walmart Inc, said on Wednesday it will consolidate its membership structure for customers and improve its e-commerce offerings by adding free shipping and opening more e-commerce warehouses this year.

title: Airbnb's 'Experiences' business on track for 1 million bookings, profitability
blurb: Airbnb Inc's year-old tours and activities business is booking tens of thousands of travelers every month and is likely to be profitable late next year, the company said on Tuesday, highlighting success in its efforts to grow beyond renting rooms and homes.

title: Shareholder Deason sues Xerox in U.S. to block Fujifilm deal
blurb: Xerox Corp <XRX.N> shareholder Darwin Deason asked a court on Tuesday to block the company's merger with Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp <4901.T>, claiming the U.S. photocopier maker's board failed shareholders by approving a deal that undervalues the company.

title: Twitter's CEO downplays chatter about possible acquisition
blurb: Twitter Inc Chief Executive Jack Dorsey said on Tuesday that he saw value in the social media network remaining an independent company, downplaying recent speculation by analysts that it could be an acquisition target.

title: Icahn, Deason urge Xerox shareholders to oppose Fujifilm deal
blurb: Xerox Corp's <XRX.N> plan to sell itself to Japan's Fujifilm Holdings <4901.T> has come under further pressure with Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason urging fellow shareholders to oppose the $6.1 billion deal.

title: NY top court says 'private' Facebook photos can be disclosed
blurb: New York state's highest court ruled on Tuesday that Facebook users may be required to turn over photos and other information that are relevant to litigation, even if they are shielded by "privacy" settings.

title: IBM sues former HR boss hired by Microsoft
blurb: International Business Machines Corp <IBM.N> sued its former executive Lindsay-Rae McIntyre, who was named Microsoft Corp's <MSFT.O> new chief diversity officer over the weekend, alleging violation of a one-year non-competitive agreement.

title: Coincheck reports to regulators over cryptocurrency heist as investors withdraw $373 million
blurb: Japanese cryptocurrency exchange Coincheck Inc, under pressure to better safeguard investors after the daring theft of $530 million (£381 million) of digital money last month, said it had on Tuesday filed a report with regulators on the hacking.

title: Apple CEO downplays special dividend at shareholder meeting
blurb: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook downplayed a suggestion that the company might issue a special dividend to shareholders with some of the $285 billion in cash that the company is now able to bring back from overseas.

title: Google to debut emails that automatically update
blurb: Gmail is about to get dynamic. Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday plans to demonstrate a software programming system that would enable emails to feature continuously updating information and greater interactivity.

title: Telegram app was targeted by crypto mining malware, Kaspersky Lab says
blurb: Previously undetected malware directed at users of the desktop version of the messaging app Telegram has been discovered by the Russian security firm Kaspersky Lab, Kaspersky said on Tuesday.

title: 'Olympic Destroyer' malware targeted Pyeongchang Games: firms
blurb: Several U.S. cyber security firms said on Monday that they had uncovered a computer virus dubbed "Olympic Destroyer" that was likely used in an attack on Friday's opening ceremony of the Pyeongchang Winter Games.

title: Daimler warns of supply chain risk from switch to electric cars
blurb: Daimler AG, owner of the Mercedes-Benz brand, warned that a fall in demand for diesel cars and a switch to electric vehicles could force it to prop up its supplier base.

title: For advertisers, Snapchat's got the kids
blurb: Social network Instagram has come to look more like rival Snapchat after copying some of its features, but marketers say Snapchat's younger audience and safeguards against poor placement drive enthusiasm for advertising on the smaller app.

title: UK initiative seeks Israeli digital health tech to assist NHS

title: Russia says hackers stole more than $17 million from its banks in 2017
